meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the laminae under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: She carefully peeled off the laminae of the onion.
meanings.sent3: The laminae on the cake were so thin, it looked like a delicate lace.
meanings.sent4: The laminae of fog blanketed the valley in the early morning.
meanings.sent5: The laminae of paint on the canvas added depth to the artwork.

meanings.definition: A thin sheet of material, such as bone or tissue
meanings.sent1: The surgeon carefully removed the laminae to access the spine.
meanings.sent2: The laminae of the leaf were transparent when held up to the light.
meanings.sent3: The laminae of paper rustled in the breeze like tiny wings.
meanings.sent4: The laminae of ice on the pond cracked under the weight of the skater.
meanings.sent5: The laminae of skin peeled back to reveal the muscle underneath.
